Class Tile

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      Tile

public class Tile
extends greenfoot.Actor

The class for an individual Tile, containing information about whether it has a mine, whether it is flagged, and how many adjacent Tiles have mines.

Version:
2014.11.11
Author:
Erik Martin

Method Detail

act

public void act()
Act method; checks for the mouse being left- or right-clicked on the Tile.

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.Actor

doClicked

public void doClicked()
Fulfill the correct actions for when the Tile is left-clicked. If the tile has a mine, call the GameWorld method revealMines. If the tile does not have a mine, reveal the tile with the number of adjacent mines displayed. If an adjacent tile has no mines nearby (and is thus "empty") reveal all connected "empty" tiles, by calling the Tile method revealAdjacent. If, however, the adjacent Tiles are incorrectly flagged, call the GameWorld method revealMines.

See Also:
revealAdjacent(Tile tile), GameWorld.revealMines(Tile tile)

doFlagged

public void doFlagged()
Add or remove a flag to/from a Tile.

findAdjacentMines

public void findAdjacentMines()
Iterates through all adjacent Tiles and adds up the number that have a mine. Stores this number in a class variable.

adjacentMines the number of adjacent mines.

revealAdjacent

public static void revealAdjacent(Tile tile)
Reveal all adjacent "empty" Tiles. This method is designed to call itself recursively in conjunction with the Tile method doClicked.

Parameters:
tile - the Tile originally clicked.
See Also:
doClicked()
